properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Gale Warning issued January 10 at 9:09AM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 kt expected, becoming west
tonight. Steep to very steep, wind-driven seas building to 10 to
13 feet this afternoon. Seas become very steep and hazardous 22
to 27 feet at 16 seconds tonight into early Saturday,
persisting Saturday afternoon. Very high and very steep seas
continue through Saturday night.

* WHERE...Small Craft Advisory conditions for all waters north of
Cape Sebastian this morning. Gales and very steep hazardous
seas are expected in the near shore waters and all waters north
of Gold Beach this afternoon and evening with small craft
advisory winds elsewhere south of Gold Beach. Very steep
hazardous seas expected for all areas beginning tonight.

* WHEN...For the Small Craft Advisory, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST
Friday. For the Gale Warning, from 1 PM to 10 PM PST Friday.
For the Hazardous Seas Warning, from 10 PM Friday to 4 AM PST
Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds and very steep seas could capsize or
damage vessels. Low visibility conditions are expected.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Mariners should alter plans to avoid strong winds and very steep
seas. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...GALE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY
